channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Barangays to continue assisting in cash aid
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Even if President Duterte has tapped soldiers and police for fund distribution, barangay or village officials would still be involved in the giving of aid to sectors affected by quarantine restrictions, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: 500 OFWs test positive for COVID; 14,669 cleared
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: More than 500 overseas Filipino workers have tested positive for coronavirus disease 2019 while 14,669 have been cleared of COVID-19 and are set to go home this month, an official said yesterday.

item.title: 1,152 quarantine violators arrested
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: Up to 1,152 people were apprehended by police for breaching quarantine protocols, after President Duterte defended Metro Manila police chief Maj. Gen. Debold Sinas from criticisms he received for supposedly violating lockdown measures during his birthday gathering on May 8.

item.title: COVID displaces 400,000 arts, culture workers
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: Some 400,000 workers in the country’s arts and culture sector have been left jobless as the government restricts mass gatherings amid the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Meralco apologizes; DOE to pursue probe
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: The Manila Electric Co. has apologized for charging consumers additional fee for the use of mobile application to settle their bills.

item.title: House panel wants clinics in public schools
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: A committee of the House of Representatives has consolidated three measures aimed at putting up clinics in all public schools nationwide, especially following projections that the threat of coronavirus disease 2019 will remain for quite some time.

item.title: DOLE tightens requirements for POGO workers
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: The Department of Labor and Employment has tightened the requirements for the issuance of permits for foreign nationals intending to work in Philippine offshore gaming operations.

item.title: ‘Politics doomed ABS-CBN provisional franchise’
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: What prompted House members to drop a proposal to grant provisional franchise to broadcast giant ABS-CBN while Congress deliberates on its franchise renewal application?

item.title: ‘Cha-cha effort dead in the water’
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Nearly two years before President Duterte steps down, efforts to amend the 1987 Constitution and push for a federal system of government may now be dead in the water.

item.title: Bicam not needed for ‘fiscally sound’ Senate CITIRA
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Congressmen do not have to meet senators in a bicameral conference committee meeting on the proposed Corporate Income Tax and Incentives Rationalization Act if they are convinced the Senate’s version of the measure is “fiscally sound.”
